alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 10:15AM CST until February 28 at 11:08PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Agricultural land and other areas near the river are extensively flooded from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd. Flood waters approach roads near the river, including Hurricane Mills Rd, Old Hwy 13 between Cedar Grove and Forks of the River Rd, Forks of the River Rd between Blue Creek Rd, Pumpkin Creek Rd, and near the Link Farm State Archaeological Area, Dyer Rd, and Tumbling Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 24.3 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Saturday was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 13.2 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.3 feet on 02/17/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1015 AM CST.
